A company wants to launch its web application in a second AWS Region. The company needs to determine which services must be regionally configured for this launch.

Which AWS services can be configured at the Region level? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:

ONLY A & E is a Regional Service

Selected Answer: AE
A. Amazon EC2
E. Amazon DynamoDB

Selected Answer: AE
A. Amazon EC2
E. Amazon DynamoDB

Amazon EC2 and Amazon DynamoDB are two AWS services that need to be configured at the region level.

Amazon EC2 instances are launched within a specified region and these instances cannot be moved across regions (although AMIs can be copied to different regions).

Amazon DynamoDB tables are created within a specific region. Although DynamoDB offers a global table feature, each replica of a global table is stored in a specific region.

On the other hand, Amazon Route 53 (option B) and Amazon CloudFront (option C) are both global services. Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable cloud Domain Name System (DNS) web service designed to route end users to Internet applications, and Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) service that delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to users globally.

AWS WAF (option D) is also a global service that protects against common web exploit patterns, such as SQL injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

Selected Answer: BE

It is configured at the Region level and allows you to create and manage DNS records for your domain names, including setting up routing policies and configuring health checks.

E. Amazon DynamoDB: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service provided by AWS. It is configured at the Region level, allowing you to create and manage DynamoDB tables within a specific AWS Region. DynamoDB offers scalable and highly available database storage for your web application.
